filmJson.name: 35mm (Silent)
filmJson.developedBy: William Kennedy Dickson & Thomas Edison (Edison Company)
filmJson.fact1: This is the most commonly used film gauge, introduced around 1889, became an international standard in 1909, and remained the dominant moving image film gauge (with variations on aspect ratio)
filmJson.fact2: This format results in 16 frames per foot of film
filmJson.fact3: This format was typically in black & white (unless hand-painted) and used nitrocellulose as a base
